titles: To the Right Honourable the knights, citizens, and burgesses, assembled in Parliament the humble petition of the workmen-printers, freemen of the city of London[.]
author: Hawkins, George, fl. 1659.
notes: Protesting against the monopoly for printing Bibles, at present possessed by Henry Hills and John Field.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Bible --  Publication and distribution --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Printing --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
